meanings.definition: The rigid observance of rules or conventions.
meanings.sent1: The school had many formalities in place to ensure everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: Before starting the meeting, they had to go through all the formalities like signing in and getting name tags.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to follow all the formalities at the fancy dinner party, but ended up wearing the name tag on its wing.
meanings.sent4: The formalities of the courtroom turned the legal process into a complex dance of rules and procedures.
meanings.sent5: The strict formalities of the royal court made it difficult for the commoners to understand the etiquette.

meanings.definition: A requirement or procedure that is customary or necessary.
meanings.sent1: The company's formalities included filling out paperwork and attending orientation sessions.
meanings.sent2: She completed all the formalities before being allowed to enter the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the formality of knocking on the door was unnecessary and preferred to meow loudly outside.
meanings.sent4: The formalities of getting a driver's license felt like jumping through hoops.
meanings.sent5: The formalities of hosting a dinner party included setting the table and preparing the food in advance.
